info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 11 at 9:19PM MDT until September 12 at 12:15AM MDT by NWS Missoula MT
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of central Idaho, including the following county, Idaho.
Idaho State Highway 13 between Kooskia and Stites.
* WHEN...Until 1215 AM MDT /1115 PM PDT/.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 918 PM MDT /818 PM PDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.7 and 1.2 inches of rain have fallen. - Idaho State Highway 13 between Kooskia and Stites. - https://www.weather.gov/mso/hydrology
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 AM MDT /1115 PM PDT/ FRIDAY
